messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] oops, correction Re: Flip a penny Tuesday
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the suggestion - it isn t my post but I do use that phrase often. Shannon ~ | | | | | |
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the suggestion - it isn't my post but I do use that phrase often.

Shannon

~>|<~.~>|<~.~>|<~.~>|<~.~>|<~.~>|<~
Did you know?...
--most well-known brands of lipstick contain lead?
--air fresheners have toxic ingredients you aren't supposed to breathe?
--most household cleaners have carcinogens and neurotoxins such as
formaldehyde, phenols and/or phosphates?
--of 2,983 everyday products, 884 have toxic chemicals?

I'm glad we switched!
We are now safer and healthier, using toxic-free products and saving money,
too. Call (212) 990-6214 for a 10 minute prerecorded presentation or contact
me directly.

-----Original Message-----
From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Leslie530@...
Sent: Wednesday, January 18, 2006 10:44 AM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] oops, correction Re: Flip a penny Tuesday


In a message dated 1/18/2006 10:43:21 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, Leslie530

writes:


In a message dated 1/18/2006 10:28:19 A.M. Eastern Standard Time, Leslie530

writes:

As the more experienced unschoolers posted about how they used the
activity,

**************

Correcting myself here.

Don't you just hate the word "used " here??? Way too schooly. Sounds like

there is a motive to the thing. :)

How about "how they enjoyed the activity" or even "how they did the
activity"?



Leslie in SC






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] oops, correction Re: Flip a penny Tuesday
messages.msgSnippet: how about I brought it up with my kids, and they were not the slightest bit interested? and that s okay! LOL! I saved the URL just in case sometime down the
messages.messageBody:
how about I brought it up with my kids, and they were not the
slightest bit interested? and that's okay!

LOL!
I saved the URL just in case sometime down the road they are
interested. I thought it was cool, but I think they were still tired
from MLKJr Day. There was a whole slew of stuff around the city
Sunday and Monday and we went to the zoo as well as parade, a
different church (a suggestion on a schooly site) and some stuff in
the library downtown (which we'd never been to).

Melissa
On Jan 18, 2006, at 9:44 AM, Leslie530@... wrote:
>
> How about "how they enjoyed the activity" or even "how they did the
> activity"?
